review: We love this thing!  I got rid of the Wii after using it for Amazon and Netflix the past year - and so glad I did.  The set up was literally a matter of plugging in the HDMI cable and connecting the unit.  I was skeptical - as we had been through the Roku box and 2 other similar media boxes- all crap.  The remote for the Fire is super sensitive to touch (which compared to even the Wii controls and other media box controls) makes it super AWESOME...including the speech feature (I was really skeptical that it would work as expected) and again...AWESOME feature.Amazon has done an incredible job with the technology and user experience of the Fire TV.  The box itself is tiny, low profile and have had no problems with Wifi signal due to location (its 3 rooms away from the router).  Excellent product- Excellent programming availability to choose from compared to any of the other media boxes.  I just cancelled my premium cable channels- downgraded to basic cable..If not for local channels and news I would probably cancel TWC all together. Tons of programming apps to choose from- including Prime- and probably end up being less than half the cost of what we paid for cable packages.

review: Absolutely love it! Easy to figure out and couldn't be easier to use, (and that's from a 74 year old, non-techie). Due to escalating costs and a fixed income, I made the decision to cancel my Cable and replace it with this. What a smart move. Don't miss the cable at all. Public broadcasting channels and my Amazon Fire TV are more than enough and as a side benefit, I've finally rid myself of that universal Cable TV frustration.........."Why am I paying for all these channels when I only use a few of them?". All in all, what more could I ask for. Don't hesitate to join me in enjoying this lovely little asset, your only regret will be the same as mine......why didn't It do this sooner.
